page.title: 13DAY CENTRE - COBHAM SURREY
page.content:
There are about 21,000 old people in Elmbridge.
Mrs Harrington of Age Concern said that the day centre is a place where elderly people meet, play snooker, knit and attend organised classes. On average 70 attend daily. It's closed at the weekend. Wednesday is wheelchair day. If old people do not live in the flats a bus will collect them. Outings are arranged such as visiting parks or houses. A day centre lunch costs 80p. They make about 400 "Meals-on-Wheels" a year.
The warden, a cook and 2 "washer-uppers" get paid, the rest are voluntary workers.
